critique: The executive order appears to be a legal document related to the Naval Aviation Cadet Act of 1942. It suspends certain provisions of the act during the war for officers who were formerly aviation cadets. The language is formal and legalistic, and the purpose seems to be administrative or legal rather than to evoke specific emotions. It is unlikely that the president wants the audience to feel any particular emotion strongly. However, a very slight sense of relief or hope might be present, so I will assign a low joy score. There is no indication of sadness, anger, fear, disgust, or surprise.
